message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.CR

This paper deals with the development of a news toxicity detector that can recognize various types of toxic content in Bulgarian news articles. The paper primarily focuses on natural language processing techniques such as ElMo, BERT, and XLM, which are commonly used in the field of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also involves the use of machine learning algorithms to train a multi-class classifier, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves the use of web crawling techniques to collect data, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper involves the development of a new dataset, which could be relevant to the field of cybersecurity (cs.CR) or cyber-physical systems (cs.CY).
